title: SS Activation

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SS Activation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

On 12/25/22 at around 12:13: AM PST ShotSpotter technology detected a possible round of gunfire near 1619 51st Ave in Oakland. According to dispatch audio, officers with OPD responded to the scene and pursued a suspect on foot.  At 12:21 (near 1231 51st Ave), they had the suspect in custody.  I am looking for records that indicate the number of officers who responded to this incident, and, if any exist, investigative reports and body camera footage from the officers who responded.  I am also looking for any arrest reports.

I request that the agency provide the above records in their native digital format, where applicable (such as a CSV, Excel, or other digital data format), and transferred to me electronically.

News media status and fee waiver:

As a reporter for WIRED, I qualify as a news media requester for the purpose of fees. Further, because this request is being made for a journalistic purpose regarding a matter of public interest, I further ask that you waive any fees. This request is not primarily in the commercial interest of myself or WIRED. Additionally, please notify me of costs before taking any billable steps.

Segregability:

If you deny this request in whole or in part, I request that you respond with the statutory exemption underlying the denial and the reasoning therein. If an asserted exemption applies to only a portion of a record, please delete or redact the portion to which the exemption applies and provide the remainder of the record.

If you have any questions about my request, please do not hesitate to e-mail me at dhruv_mehrotra@wired.com. Conde Nast's legal counsel is also copied on this letter. We look forward to a response as quickly as possible under applicable law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: 18-0693 Body Cam Records Request for Case Involving Officer Daniel Russo

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: 18-0693 Body Cam Records Request for Case Involving Officer Daniel Russo
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Under the New York Open Records Act, §86(3)-87 et seq., I am requesting police records of the Rochester Police, specifically incident number CR#17-084858 also referred to as case number 18-0693. The officer involved in this incident was  Daniel  Russo.  My request includes but is not limited to documents, incident reports, multimedia, body-worn camera footage, arrest filings, and other documentation linked to the incident. It also includes all documents, notes, correspondence, and memoranda evidencing sustained findings reports, and investigations, and all communication and correspondence in whatever tangible medium between the officials, the victims, and the overseeing agency.

As per law, police misconduct records are public records and do not qualify for any exemption, and are not listed as confidential records.

This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

The New York Open Records Act requires a response time within five days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at shaynacf@stanford.edu or my colleague, Eric Sagara at esagara@stanford.edu or his phone number, (520)275-7506.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within five business days, as the statute requires.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shayna Freedman

title: Buzz the Security Bee

communications.communication:
Dear Department of Commerce, Office of Security (OSY):

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

I am seeking records related to Buzz the Security Bee, OSY's "security mascot" for the U.S. Census Bureau's National Processing Center in Jeffersonville, Indiana. According to the attached archived OYS website, Buzz was introduced in late 2006 and was developed to spread security awareness. The contact person on the website is Debra Rochner, so she may be one person to ask about responsive records (if she is still with the agency) or whose files or correspondence may have responsive records.

Specifically, I request the following records:

1. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, and design of the Buzz the Security Bee mascot. Please include any contracts or design concepts (e.g. sketches) in your production, as well as any records related to OYS's decision to create a security mascot in the first place.

2. Please produce all Buzz-related promotional items, educational items, or tchotchkes, past or present, that took the form of records, such as trading cards, posters, videos, worksheets, or books (including but not limited to coloring books, activity books, or comic books). Please include any related contracts or correspondence.

3. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, design, and use of any wearable Buzz costume that may have been created. Responsive records would include contracts for the design or production of such a costume; design proposals or sketches; correspondence with the designer or manufacturer; and any guidelines related to the use of or care for the costume.

4. Please produce all communications related to Buzz.

5. Please produce all correspondence related to Buzz (or to mascots in general) sent to or from any member of Congress, their office, or their staff. Senator Tom Coburn (R-OK) may have sent some responsive correspondence around 2007, and Senator Joni Ernst (R-IA) may have sent some around 2019.

6. Please produce all records related to any proposal or decision to stop using the Buzz mascot.

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

title: Requesting educational materials from Inter-Agency Working Group (Chicago Department of Public Health)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

As part of the city's voluntary compliance agreement with the federal Dept of Housing and Urban Development, the city formed an Interagency Working Group (IWG) convened by the Dept of Public Health and the Office of Climate and Environmental Equity tasked with receiving "education and support to identify actions within the scope of their authority to promote environmental justice and address cumulative impacts" and producing an environmental justice action plan.

I am requesting records sufficient to show:
- the dates of meetings of the IWG from its formation to the present
- the agendas and minutes of those meetings
- any of the educational documents, resources, trainings, or other related materials provided to the IWG in support of this process

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Moser

communications.subject: Public Safety - Public Records Request :: P030299-070623
communications.communication:
Dear Jamie Daly: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of NMDPS. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of New Mexico Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 7/6/2023 and given the reference number P030299-070623 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:
State of New Mexico v. Nicholas Ortiz
Case number:
D-101-CR-201500203
AND/OR
D-101-CR-201500087
As the conviction in this case was affirmed by the New Mexico supreme court, I am requesting the following:
Copies of video/audio recording of:
Initial police contact, arrest, interview, statements, or questioning (if any) of Nicholas Ortiz in 2011 or 2012. This includes any
surveillance video, if any.
Police contact, arrest, interview, statements, questioning, or other contact with Ashley Roybal, starting on or around September 2012
to January 2016, if any.
Police contact, arrest interview, statements, questioning, or other contact with Jose Roybal starting on or around September 2012 to
January 2016, if any.
Audio/video recording of Nicholas Ortiz while in police custody on or around February 2015. This includes observed phone calls and
records of relevant text messages obtained by investigators through this time as reported.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I
would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within
15 business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
Jamie Daly 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek, and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request.  You will be contacted about the availability of records, and/or provided with copies of the records in question within 15 days. If there are associated costs you will be notified, and must pay prior to receipt of the records. 
Any responsive records will be provided immediately if records have been located, they are public records, and there is no associated charge. Otherwise, within 15 days of your request, you will be notified if the DPS has encountered difficulties responding to your request, and provided the DPS’ estimate of when you will receive any records located. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
NMDPS To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HfVqLGPU4gtT4XcDd66mnMCV-2BIer3WNX-2F7scYuqCJbgmq7axwdk1QROUXRELg1Ibxw-3D-3D2ipV_6YS99AL3xNq182f0b92T2XS9-2B3Rir8N8gU1TXp-2BrE4M40QWmnhq9KIHPfbHRiHZFptDCYCHei65D-2FC0Wueh9sj-2Bs7oksTnGVOBtRfsXm9kI1Ah6zjDp9XqyHJGZfdYl1FLR3Sol9zaHo6kDxMZUHRQgII-2Bvnns3oovnYaBsIEnnttDBjZE9giTvzV9TIUQ8UShwElQSd-2FDaoJkq4dqPaGR7bLzl2Vt6fviYytWYJba0-3D)

title: 2022 Chicago Lead Poisoning Data

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please provide all records sufficient to show the number of child lead poisoning cases and rates by ZIP Codes in Chicago for the year 2022.

The data should be similar to that published on the Chicago Health Atlas: https://chicagohealthatlas.org/indicators/LDPC?topic=lead-poisoning

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Feliciano Ocegueda

title: NYC location data

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NYC location data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) All records of scheduled meetings between CobWebs Technologies representatives and the Queens District Attorney's office, including but not limited to Angelica Quintero, a senior purchasing employee at the District Attorney's office from January 1, 2022 to the present including any written or recorded notes from the meetings.

2) All records of scheduled meetings between CobWebs Technologies representatives and Queens District Attorney's office public information or media relations department from January 1, 2022 to the present including any written or recorded notes from the meetings

3) All email exchanges -- including incoming messages, outgoing messages, forwards, and attachments -- between the Queens DA Melinda Katz and other members of the DA's office and CobWebs Technologies representatives from January 1, 2022 to the present. CobWebs Technologies representatives can be identified by searching the department's email system for addresses ending in "@cobwebs.com"

4) All emails exchanges–including incoming messages, outgoing messages, forwards, and attachments–between the department's public information and/or media relations staff members and CobWebs representatives from January 1, 2022 to the present. CobWebs representatives can be identified by searching the department's email system for addresses ending in "@cobwebs.com"

5) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the DA's use of CobWebs products WebLoc and Tangles. This includes A) any notes taking during meetings that discussed the use of CobWebs programs WebLock and Tangles, B) any explanations (whether internally or externally generated) of how these programs works, and C) any other document that has been used to help explain the use of these programs to any party, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

I ask that all fees be waived as I intend to use the requested records to further public understanding of government functions and not for any commercial purpose.

In the event that you choose to withhold or redact the records, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation of the statutory and/or case law upon which each rejection or redaction is based.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Johana Bhuiyan

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Johana Bhuiyan

title: Pittsburgh Pirates/MLB and city government correspondence regarding air quality

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pittsburgh Pirates/MLB and city government correspondence regarding air quality
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

1)All external correspondence regarding air quality, including email, phone, fax, or video (i.e., Google Meet/Hangouts, Zoom, etc.) between the Pittsburgh Pirates and the City of Pittsburgh Mayor's Office.
2) All external correspondence regarding air quality, including email, phone, fax, or video, between Major League Baseball (MLB) and the City of Pittsburgh Mayor's Office .
3) All external correspondence regarding air quality, including email, phone, fax, or video, between the Major League Baseball Player's Association (MLBPA) and the City of Pittsburgh Mayor's Office.
4) All internal correspondence (including email, phone, fax, or video) regarding the Pittsburgh Pirates, MLB, and MLBPA.

Between the dates 06/26/2023 and the date this request is received.

If you determine that any information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary and, if so, whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge and processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I also ask that our request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available (email: holler@bwd.nyc) – if not, secure file transfer, thumb drive, or CD-ROM. I am also available via phone at 718.360.6359 to discuss any questions you have about the request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bradford William Davis

title: FPS2

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FPS2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to the the CMS Website, in 2011, the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (“CMS”) developed and implemented the Fraud Prevention System (“FPS”), now FPS2, to implement predictive analytics technologies to identify and prevent the payment of fraudulent claims in the Medicare Fee-for-Service Program. The FPS 2 develops models to identify fraud waste and abuse and monitor the models to validate effective alerting.

I am seeking:

1) Contracts, memorandums of understanding, and statements of work between the department and any outside party regarding the implementation and development of FPS2 of any service to detect or predict fraud

2) Documentation of FPS 2 or predictive models that the agency currently uses (including those used as aids to human decision making). This documentation should include, where available: executive summaries of the algorithm/model's purpose, lists of the data sources, breakdowns of how the model weights various input data, descriptions of the statistical or machine learning techniques employed, the results of validation and accuracy testing, disparate impact studies, and algorithmic impact reports.

3) A data dictionary/library for each predictive or detection model or algorithm identified in response to items 1 and 2 of this requests.

4) Copies of any internal or independent audits of the identified models or algorithms.

5) Aggregate or disaggregated data, if any exists, breaking down the risk scores or outputs of the fraud model.

6) Training data code and model files for the above algorithms.

As required under FOIA, I request that the agency provide the above records in their native digital format, where applicable (such as a CSV, Excel, or other digital data format), and transferred to me electronically.

News media status and fee waiver:

As a reporter for WIRED, I qualify as a news media requester for the purpose of fees. See 5 U.S.C. 552(a)(4)(A)(ii). Further, because this request is being made for a journalistic purpose regarding a matter of public interest, I further ask that you waive any fees. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). Disclosure of information regarding the use of predictive analytics will contribute significantly to public understanding of how CMS uses advanced machine learning technology. This request is not primarily in the commercial interest of myself or WIRED.

Additionally, please notify me of costs before taking any billable steps.

Segregability:

If you deny this request in whole or in part, I request that you respond with the statutory
exemption underlying the denial and the reasoning therein. If an asserted exemption applies to
only a portion of a record, please delete or redact the portion to which the exemption applies and
provide the remainder of the record, as required under the FOIA.

If you have any questions about my request, please do not hesitate to e-mail me or call
me. Conde Nast's legal counsel is also copied on this letter. We look forward to a response as quickly as possible under the provisions of the Freedom of Information
Act (5 U.S.C. Section 552).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: FBI file: Brigid Berlin

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI file: Brigid Berlin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of FBI files on Brigid Berlin, a New York artist and socialite whose death was widely reported in the media in July 2020. Here is one example: https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/18/arts/brigid-berlin-dead.html

According to news reports, she was born Brigid Emmett Berlin in Manhattan on Sept. 6, 1939. I request that you use those details to augment your search.

I request that your agency conduct a full CRS search, as well as a cross reference search, to retrieve records related to this prominent American.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: Aerial video of 2023 Kīlauea eruptions

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Aerial video of 2023 Kīlauea eruptions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All aerial videos taken during flights, both manned and unmanned, to monitor the 2023 Kīlauea eruptions, including the eruption from January through March and also the one in June.

The events are described here on the agency website: https://www.usgs.gov/volcanoes/kilauea/recent-eruption

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: SS Activation (NYPD 49th Precinct)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: SS Activation (NYPD 49th Precinct)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

On Friday, June 30, 2023 at around 1:13AM there was a report of a gunshot at Paulding Ave & Mace Ave, Bronx, New York, 10469 due to a shot spotter activation.  According to dispatch radio, NYPD officers of the 47th or 49th precincts responded and made contact with multiple witnesses who stated they heard fireworks in the area. I am looking for body camera footage and incident reports for this incident.  

If possible, to identify these records, look for any records for police responding to an incident of reported gunfire from the evening of June 29th 2023 to June 30 2023 before 7 AM near Paulding Ave and Mace Ave in the Bronx. A possible address is 2549 Colden Ave.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Communications Regarding Vote Changes in the New York State Senate

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Communications Regarding Vote Changes in the New York State Senate
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Given recent reports in the Buffalo News regarding instances of retroactively altered votes in the New York State Senate, I am seeking access to the following records:

1. Any and all written communications, including but not limited to emails, memos, and text messages, among Senate members, their staff, and any other relevant parties, regarding the alteration of votes on the bill allowing Gov. Kathy Hochul to enter a new gaming compact with the Seneca Nation and the bill rolling back a major campaign finance reform law. This should cover the period from June 1, 2023, to the present.

2. Any and all instructions or guidelines provided to Senate members or their staff regarding the process or possibility of altering votes after they have been cast. This should cover the period from January 1, 2023, to the present.

3. Any and all records of requests made by Senate members to alter their votes after they have been cast, including the reasons provided for such requests. This should cover the period from January 1, 2023, to the present.

I understand that there may be fees associated with the processing of this request. Please inform me of any such fees before processing the request.

If any part of this request is denied, please cite the specific exemption you believe justifies your refusal to release the information and inform me of your agency's appeal procedures.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Communication between Jennifer Raab and Hector Batista (CUNY — City College of New York)
communications.communication:
Akash Mehta

MuckRock.com


Dear Mr. Mehta:


I write in response to your request below dated July 5, 2023, pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law ("FOIL") (N.Y. Public Officers Law §§ 84-90).


Please be advised that I serve as the Records Access Officer for The City College of New York ("City College"), which is one of the constituent colleges of The City University of New York ("CUNY").  Under FOIL, each individual CUNY college, including City College, is considered a separate ​"agency," as is the CUNY Central Office.


City College does not have access to and is not in possession of any emails or text messages between Jennifer Raab and Hector Batista, as neither is a City College employee, and therefore we are not in possession of any records responsive to your FOIL request.


By copy of this email, I am referring your FOIL request to the Records Access Officer of the CUNY Central Office (CUNY.RecordsOfficer@cuny.edu).  Please direct any further correspondence concerning this matter to that office.


Sincerely,


Paul F. Occhiogrosso, Esq.

Executive Counsel to the President

The City College of New York

Wille Administration Building, Rm. 200

160 Convent Avenue

New York, NY 10031

e-mail: pocchiogrosso@ccny.cuny.edu<mailto:pocchiogrosso@ccny.cuny.edu>

title: FOIA Devereaux Knox Vietnam War  ST-2

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Devereaux Knox Vietnam War  ST-2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

OMPF for Devereaux Knox including cumulative record of training, history of assignments, military education, transfers and receipts, all military decorations and citations, personnel evaluations, unit awards, deployments South Vietnam.
1) History of Assignments NAVPERS form 601-5
2) Navy Occupational training history NAVPERS 601-4
3) Cumulative transfers and receipts NAVPERS 601-12, administrative remarks
4) Bronze Star Medal award citations, Navy Commendation Medal citations
Retired Master Chief MMCM, retired 1988. Awards include Bronze Star Medal with Combat V, Navy Commendation Medal, Combat Action Ribbon, good conduct medal, Presidential Unit Citation, Navy Unit Commendation, Vietnam Service Medal. Service with ST-2 SEAL TEAM TWO  Vietnam Conflict 1967 to 1969, UDT-21. Training includes Underwater Demolition Team Replacement UDTR training, Basic Airborne School, SERE, 5321 UDT Swimmer, 5326 Navy SEAL.
Passed away Thursday, May 20, 2010.

Please redact any sensitive information protected in accordance with the Privacy Act of 1974.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Eric Bradley

communications.subject: NYSP FOIL REQUEST
communications.communication:
July 3, 2023

Don Stone
MuckRock News, DEPT MR148537
263 Huntington Avenue
Boston, Massachusetts 02115
Re: FOIL Number NYSP-23-07-013
Dear Don Stone:
This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by New York State Police on July 3, 2023. The request was for "Any Vetting of William F. Howard for Employment at SUNY or State of New York Dept. of Homeland Security.".
Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.
A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached by or before September 6, 2023.
Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.
PLEASE NOTE: **
As we have acknowledged your request, please refrain from submitting duplicate requests for the same records through Open FOIL.  Submitting a duplicate request takes time away from processing the hundreds of requests received each month.  If you have additional information to add to your request, or you would like to know the status of your request, please contact the FOIL Unit via email or call us at (518) 464-7100, option #2.


Sincerely,
[cid:image001.jpg@01D9AD84.840AD110]
Staff Inspector William H. Gorman
Records Access Officer
Central Records Bureau
